Class PopUpFragment

java.lang.Object
  DialogFragment
      com.plumcreektechnology.tala0_0.PopUpFragment

public class PopUpFragment
extends DialogFragment

this fragment gives you more options for learning about a point, removes the point, or is dismissed

Author:
Devin Frenze, Nora Hayes

newInstance

static PopUpFragment newInstance(java.lang.String[] ids,
                                 java.lang.String[] names,
                                 boolean dismiss)
builds a PopUpFragment from the arguments and returns it

Parameters:
ids - IDs of the places to be displayed
names - names of the places to be displayed
dismiss - a boolean for whether the application should be shut down when the pop up is dismissed (if the user was running something else) or if it should stay open (if it was already open)
Returns:
PopUpFragment to display

onCreate

onCreateDialog

public Dialog onCreateDialog(Bundle savedInstanceState)
builds the entire PopUpFragment as a Dialog from the arguments supplied in newInstance The system calls this only when creating the layout in a dialog.
